citations.narrative:
The licensee did not have a record of acquisition for a baby capybara that was purchased in September, 2023.
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following
information concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise
disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born or hatched of any animal while in his
or her possession or under his or her control, to the extent that any identification or counting of offspring can be carried
out without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities.
Records for all animal acquisitions and dispositions must be kept and maintained. These records must include the name
and address from whom the animal was acquired, the USDA license of the person the animal was acquired, the date of
purchase and the species of animal acquired.
To be corrected from this day forward, November 21, 2023

citations.desc: Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers.
citations.narrative:
The facility acquired a baby capybara from an unlicensed broker in September, 2023.
No exhibitor shall knowingly obtain any animal from any person who is required to be licensed but who does not hold a
current, valid, and unsuspended license.
All wild and/or exotic animals must be acquired from a licensed facility.
To be corrected from this day forward, November 20, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee did not have a record of acquisition for a baby capybara that was purchased in September, 2023. 
Every exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the following 
information concerning animals other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or 
otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise 
disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The records shall include any offspring born or hatched of any animal while in his 
or her possession or under his or her control, to the extent that any identification or counting of offspring can be carried 
out without unduly disturbing nesting or rearing activities. 
Records for all animal acquisitions and dispositions must be kept and maintained. These records must include the name 
and address from whom the animal was acquired, the USDA license of the person the animal was acquired, the date of 
purchase and the species of animal acquired. 
To be corrected from this day forward, November 21, 2023 
2.132(d)  Critical
   
Procurement of dogs, cats, and other animals; dealers. 
The facility acquired a baby capybara from an unlicensed broker in September, 2023. 
No exhibitor shall knowingly obtain any animal from any person who is required to be licensed but who does not hold a 
current, valid, and unsuspended license. 
All wild and/or exotic animals must be acquired from a licensed facility. 
To be corrected from this day forward, November 20, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
